result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell O Shepherd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
Consecutive to: 15CF1187

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new law violations.

No contact with: Spencer Grant.  
  No operation of a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet already previously obtained. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
To be performed as a condition of probation.
3/15/2017 - ON THIS CASE, 15CM1646 AND 15CF1187, DEFENDANT IS TO SERVE A TOTAL OF 80 HOURS COMMUNITY SERVICE.

Defendant Mitchell O Shepherd in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the negative WCS report. The Defendant is to go get tested and return back to Court and the Court will recall the case.  The Court recalls the case.  The Defendant tested positive for THC at WCS.  The Court increases cash bail by $1000.00 with the same conditions.  The Court will pemit Huber Bailee Status.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.
